ThingDef.label: riparius book
ThingDef.description:
Tiberium Riparius:

The green kind of Tiberium which can be found the most, it exists in various forms with the most common one being Riparius.
It came to planet Earth a long time ago, long before this rim world has been infected, where it crashed near the Tiber river, giving it it's name.
While being the most common type it is also the least valuable out of all known ones, though it varies inbetween the different green forms.

It is recommended to avoid it at all costs and limit exposure to critical research only.
The substance, no matter the kind, will infect any carbon based lifeform and crystalize it sooner or later depending on the gravity of exposure. Death may occur within hours or within years depending on your luck.
This feature of Tiberium is not merely toxic, it affects any other mineral surrounding it which is converted into more Tiberium, consuming any landscape.

ThingDef.label: vinifera book
ThingDef.description:
Tiberium Vinifera:

The blue kind of Tiberium which can be seen as the 'mature' form of Riparius.
It is rather rare compared to the green Tiberium types. This is partially due to the slow growth in comparision.

This type explains the theory that Tiberium is more of a living being.
This kind remains toxic and affects living beings just like any other kind, turning them into various lifeforms.
These Tiberium lifeforms are not necessarily hostile though very dangerous compared to any known terrestrial creature, mutated plants however seem to bear valuable resources.
This kind opens the question whether Tiberium 'lives' or not, it seems like this won't be the last of it.

ThingDef.label: rutila book
ThingDef.description:
Tiberium Rutila:

The red kind of Tiberium, which seems to be very rare.
It appears only in the form of red Tiberium shards which fall from the sky, huge pillars of glowing red crystal, radiating warmth and inducing an uneasy feeling.
Sightings on Earth revealed that red Tiberium doesn't spread, however it seems to have evolved the ability to do so, although, very slowly.

This kind and types associated with it bear many mysteries we cannot understand. Only time will tell what the purpose and origin of these crystals might be. It could be a natural alien rock, or a alien weapon.

ThingDef.label: tiberium wood
ThingDef.description: This wood-like matter is unfortunately not usable like regular wood, except you want to breathe toxic spores all day. However it might be useful for medical application.

ThingDef.label: tiberium grass
ThingDef.description: This alien grass seems.. alive? You should most likely avoid traversing it.

ThingDef.label: tiberium shroom
ThingDef.description: These plants seem to be a sort of fungi, heavily mutated or even evolved in these death driven fields. Just like the wood and grass that can be found nearby, it might be useful for medical application.

ThingDef.label: tiberium berries
ThingDef.description: A bunch of strange fruit from various Tiberium flora, while not consumable, it could prove useful.
